newsitem.title: UK: Kingfisher leads retail sector rebound.
newsitem.headline: Kingfisher leads retail sector rebound.

text.p: Shares in UK retailer Kingfisher led its sector higher on Friday on follow-through buying from yesterday as traders re-evaluated the UK annual budget delivered earlier this week, dealers said.
The shares were up 12p to 644-1/2p at 0908 GMT. Argos added 11p to 770-1/2p, GUS climbed 7p to 674-1/2p, while Dixons rose 3p to 573-1/2p.

Shares in Kingfisher and Dixons were hit hardest on Tuesday, after Chancellor Kenneth Clarke unveiled his budget, which contained tax measures that potentially affect insurance policies sold with consumer durables.
"It feels like a bit of a squeeze," added one marketmaker.
Separately the UK Treasury said economic data had confirmed there was rising housing market activity coupled with strong consumer demand.
October net consumer credit rose 856 million stg while final M4 money supply showed 10.3 percent growth in the year to October.
